title.description: Short, clear title for the simulation. Should indicate the physics concept. Examples: "Toss Ball", "Two Boxes Collision", "Pendulum Motion"

description.description: Brief educational description for students explaining what they can learn or observe. Keep it engaging.

environment.description: Environment settings. Controls canvas boundaries and gravity.

walls.description: Array of walls to include. Options: "left", "right", "top", "bottom". Empty array [] = no walls (objects can exit canvas). Use walls to contain objects or create bounce surfaces.

gravity.description: Gravity strength. Default: 0.001 (realistic fall). Set to 0 for top-down simulations or zero-gravity. Higher values = faster falling.

objects.description: Array of physics objects in the simulation. 1-3 objects recommended.

items.description: A physics object in the simulation. Configure shape, position, velocity, and physics properties.

id.description: Unique identifier for this object (e.g., "ball", "boxA", "platform"). Used by controls, outputs, and graphs to reference this object.

x.description: Initial X position in pixels (0-800). Center of canvas is 400. Leave margins from edges.

y.description: Initial Y position in pixels (0-600). Center of canvas is 300. Y increases DOWNWARD.

body.description: Shape configuration for a physics body. Choose from: rectangle, circle, polygon, or vertex (custom shape).

oneOf.description: Rectangular body shape. Use for boxes, platforms, walls.

width.description: Width in pixels (40-100 recommended for visibility)

height.description: Height in pixels (40-100 recommended for visibility)

oneOf.description: Circular body shape. Use for balls, wheels, planets.

radius.description: Radius in pixels (20-50 recommended for visibility)

oneOf.description: Regular polygon body shape. Use for triangles, pentagons, hexagons.

sides.description: Number of sides (3 = triangle, 5 = pentagon, 6 = hexagon, etc.)

radius.description: Radius from center to vertices in pixels

oneOf.description: Custom polygon defined by vertices. Use for irregular shapes, ramps, custom obstacles.

vertices.description: Array of {x, y} points defining the polygon vertices in order

items.description: 2D vector for position, velocity, or acceleration. Coordinate system: origin (0,0) at TOP-LEFT, X increases right, Y increases DOWNWARD.

x.description: X component. For velocity: positive = rightward, negative = leftward. For position: 0-800 range.

y.description: Y component. For velocity: positive = downward, negative = upward. For position: 0-600 range.

velocity.description: Initial velocity {x, y} in px/frame. Typical range: -30 to 30. Negative Y = upward motion.

x.description: X component. For velocity: positive = rightward, negative = leftward. For position: 0-800 range.

y.description: Y component. For velocity: positive = downward, negative = upward. For position: 0-600 range.

acceleration.description: Initial acceleration {x, y}. Usually not set directly; gravity provides Y acceleration.

x.description: X component. For velocity: positive = rightward, negative = leftward. For position: 0-800 range.

y.description: Y component. For velocity: positive = downward, negative = upward. For position: 0-600 range.

restitution.description: Bounciness (0-1). 0 = no bounce, 1 = perfect bounce, 0.8 = realistic. Default: 0.8

frictionAir.description: Air resistance (0-1). 0 = no drag, 0.01-0.05 = light damping, 0.1 = high drag. Default: 0

friction.description: Surface friction (0-1). Affects sliding against other objects. Default: 0.1

isStatic.description: If true, object is immovable (good for floors, walls, platforms). Default: false

controls.description: Interactive controls (sliders, toggles) for students to adjust parameters. Include at least one for interactivity.

items.description: Interactive control for students to adjust simulation parameters. Sliders for numeric values, toggles for booleans.

oneOf.description: Slider control for adjusting numeric properties. Allows students to experiment with different values.

label.description: Display label shown to users (e.g., "Initial Velocity", "Box A Speed")

targetObj.description: ID of the object to control (must match an object's id)

min.description: Minimum slider value. Velocity: typically -30. Position X: 0. Position Y: 0.

max.description: Maximum slider value. Velocity: typically 30. Position X: 800. Position Y: 600.

step.description: Slider increment. Use 0.1 for fine control, 1 for coarse control.

defaultValue.description: Initial value when simulation loads. Should match the object's initial property value.

targetObj.description: ID of the object to control (must match an object's id)

outputs.description: Real-time value displays. Group by object. Show velocity, acceleration, position as relevant.

items.description: A group of output values, typically for one object. Groups values visually.

values.description: Array of values to display in this group

items.description: A single value to display in real-time.

targetObj.description: ID of the object to read from (must match an object's id)

graphs.description: Time-series graphs to visualize property changes. Great for comparing related quantities.

items.description: Graph configuration. Currently supports line graphs for time-series data.

oneOf.description: Time-series line graph. X-axis is time, Y-axis shows property values. Great for comparing velocity vs acceleration.

title.description: Graph title (e.g., "Velocity Over Time", "Position vs Time")

yAxisRange.description: Y-axis range. X-axis is always time.

min.description: Minimum Y-axis value. Set to encompass expected values with padding.

max.description: Maximum Y-axis value. Set to encompass expected values with padding.

lines.description: Array of lines to plot. Use contrasting colors for multiple lines.

items.description: Configuration for a single line on a graph.

label.description: Line label for the legend (e.g., "Velocity Y", "Box A Position")

color.description: Line color as hex (e.g., "#ff6bff"). Match object colors for visual consistency.

targetObj.description: ID of the object to track (must match an object's id)
